intro: Fleischmannia ciliolifera, commonly known as the silky fleischmannia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments with minimal water availability. Its unique floral structure supports pollination by specific insect species, contributing to its ecological significance in its native range.
